mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Price, Chandler, 1765 or 6-1827
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Informed him previously of English vessels having been taken up by Americans to proceed to the Mississippi and Florida to procure cotton; now British merchantmen from Great Britain are pursuing same plan; Spaniards hold strip of land east of Mississippi as part of West Florida; speculators plan to ship cotton from there.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1808 December 15, Phila[delphia, Pennsylvania] to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
